disobedience.question: Was I disobedient to my parents?
disobedience.description: As per the fourth commandment, it's a child's duty to respond to parental love, wisdom, and respect with obedience.

disobedience.question: Did I reject the unity of the Church when my frustration with the imperfections of others led me to view them as obstacles to Christ's prayer that they may all be one?
disobedience.description: Rejecting Church unity due to frustration with individuals is sinful because it confuses the Church's divine nature and eternal truths with the human imperfections of its members, while also violating Christ's prayer "that they may all be one."

disobedience.question: Did you reject the unity of the Church when frustrated with its imperfect members, thus violating Christ's prayer for all believers to be one?
disobedience.description: Rejecting Church unity due to frustration with individuals is sinful because it confuses the Church's divine nature and eternal truths with the human imperfections of its members, while also violating Christ's prayer "that they may all be one."

disobedience.question: Did I use my words to mock or belittle the Church?
disobedience.description: Mocking the church shows contempt for Christ's established institution on earth, disrespects the Body of Christ, and undermines the Church's divine authority as guided by the Holy Spirit.

disobedience.question: Have I, through my actions and attitudes, disobeyed my mother and father?
disobedience.description: Respecting parental authority helps maintain proper order in families and society, and that parents deserve honor for their role in giving life, nurturing, and forming their children in faith and virtue.

uncharity.description: This sin dehumanizes people on the margins when we are called to love each other as a child of God as Jesus loved us.

uncharity.question: Did I give alms to impress others, rather than for the love of God?
uncharity.description: Seeking praise for charitable giving is sinful because it transforms an act meant to glorify God and help others into an exercise of pride and self-glorification.

uncharity.question: Did I prioritize my own needs and desires over those of my family, especially during difficult times?

extracted_data_phrases: of love and respect as children of God

uncharity.question: Did I allow others to be treated unjustly?
uncharity.description: This sin violates the principles of justice, charity, and our moral obligation to defend human dignity and protect our neighbors from harm when we have the ability to intervene.

extracted_data_phrases: from helping others when they needed my assistance

greed.description: This sin makes money an idol that replaces trust in God's providence, turning what should be a tool for good into an object of worship.

autonomy.question: Did you take for granted the good things in your life, forgetting to acknowledge their source in God's providence?
